website_summaries.verdict: These bags are a cost effective alternative to name brand diaper pail refills and they do the job just as well.
pros: More economical alternative to name brand refills
Bags do a solid job containing odor and are durable enough to reliably hold dirty diapers without tearing
Entire package holds up to 816 newborn diapers
Fits in most Diaper Genie models seamlessly
cons: It can be tough to find the beginning of the roll to start the bag off when opening package

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Munchkin step pail
customer_reviews.text: These bags work perfectly for a munchkin step pail. They are a tiny bit thinner, but that actually helps the roll unwind as you put more diapers in the bags. There is ZERO stink or diaper smell. I saved a lot of money buying these and they work flawlessly. You will save money and won't be disappointed if you have the munchkin step diaper pail.
customer_reviews.author: D. Manning

customer_reviews.title: No nasty odors = great product and price!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the more expensive Diaper Genie brand of diaper bag refills, that is hands down the best! Other generic brands are 1) poorly designed which means a nasty odor always lingers from dirty diapers or 2) cheaply designs it so it runs out faster. This brand not only locks in the odor inside the bag of our Diaper Genie, which means no foul smells in the nursery, but also lasts a very long time before we even need to purchase extra refills. Definitely a great product and a great price point!
customer_reviews.author: spicygreenmango

customer_reviews.title: Do not contain odor as well
customer_reviews.text: I got these hoping for. Cheaper alternative to the munchkin diaper pail refills for my munchkin diaper pail. Unfortunately these do not contain the odor nearly as well as the munchkin bags. I have to dispose of these bags well before they are even full, gagging in the process. They were easy to install. Will not purchase again and do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: it can be easily removed and then these will fit
customer_reviews.text: In newer Diaper Genies there is a plastic piece that prevents you from using off-brand bags... it can be easily removed and then these will fit. However, the quality is slightly less than name brand (or even Walmart brand). The biggest problem we had is that the manufacturer doesn't always put the opened-end close to the 'top' and mark it with a white sticker. In one case my wife wound up pulling half the bag out of the holster to find the end, making that refill useless, giving us a 7 pack instead of 8. I will try a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the Munchkin diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: My family has the larger Munchkin diaper pail with the foot pedal opener, and these bags work great! We used to buy the name brand one but notice no practical difference between the two other than the color of the plastic and the price. We have used these for months now. We were a little worried about some reviews saying they were not as good, but is simply not the case from our perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Too Tight of a Fit
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit my brand new Diaper Genie very well. Several of the refills are warped and not in a circle shape (see picture). I can get the top lid to close but literally feel like I'm going to break it every time. Also as others have said, the plastic is thinner and all around cannot compare to the OEM refills. Furthermore every time I push a diaper down into the bin more and more plastic feeds into the bottom wasting large amounts. For these reasons I will not be purchasing any more.
customer_reviews.author: John John

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These have worked really well so far in our munchkin step pail. I bought the amazon brand last time and they never fed out properly, but these are a much better fit! I can’t say the odor control is perfect, especially compared to the actual munchkin brand, but they’re pretty darn good and a great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. S

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: (Used this for my son from NB-5 months) Ordered this same pack Jan 2017, and I just started the last refill 2 days ago. So, while this pack did not last the year they said it would, I am still very impressed. These refills seem to last longer then the actual diaper genie OEM refills! They don't really smell that much, but then again I change the carbon deodorizer in the diaper genie often, so maybe that helps? I just ordered this pack again, and will continue to do so. It lasts a looong time, and is the cheapest option there is. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: These are not even closely comparable to the name brand ones! First off, it was tricky to find the start of the bag. When I finally did, there was so much excess, that I had to just keep pulling it all through, essentially wasting a bunch. Second, these DO NOT keep the smell in and my cheapskate butt is reminded of that every time I open the lid to put a diaper in! Next time I will save the hassle and my nose and spend the few extra dollars buying the real ones!
customer_reviews.author: Ekris23

customer_reviews.title: Good enough...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I love that it's cheaper than the name-brand, and I like buying things in bulk. Cons: The bags sometimes piece-off, leaving small bits of blue plastic in my diaper genie base. Also, I received a pack that was improperly made and the diaper genie's lid wouldn't shut correctly. I didn't realize this until I had already opened the package and one of the refills, so couldn't return it. One out of four purchases have been this way, but I guess sometimes you only get what you pay for. Due to the necessity during the diaper phase and price, I'll probably continue purchasing these, unless the poor fit happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T.

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not hesitate to buy these! They last sooooo much longer then the brand name refills and work even better. And this value?!? Are you kidding me?!? Totally worth it! I’m kicking myself that I just found this deal right when we are gearing up to start potty training lol
customer_reviews.author: The Baumgarners

customer_reviews.title: Bust proof
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. You can pack these suckers full and not bust out the side of a bag. We have tested the boundaries and strength of plastic on these and they held true. They don’t do much for odor control, but are a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Which pretty much means the DON'T fit Diaper Genie's made last ...
customer_reviews.text: "These Nursery Fresh diaper pail refills are GUARANTEED TO FIT all Diaper Genie II Elite and Diaper Genie II pails, and guaranteed to fit all Diaper Genie Essentials and Diaper Genie Elite pails purchased prior to March 1, 2014"...... Which pretty much means the DON'T fit Diaper Genie's made last year.....it fits......ok. I have enough of them to last about 6 months....and will be reading the fine print much more carefully next time, as these are not as good for my model of Diaper Genie as what was on the shelves at Target. Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: S. Garsson

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: We have the Munchkin step pail and you can shove a ridiculous amount of diapers in the pail with these bags! I was nervous about trying an off brand but these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Harder to use than others.
customer_reviews.text: I was not as impressed with these. They are a little better than another generic one I bought, but the roll was harder to start than any other one I had before and didn’t really seem to lock in to my diaper pail. And my living room smelled like diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Messner

customer_reviews.title: Just as good
customer_reviews.text: These work just as good as the name brand. I have a regular diaper genie. The refill doesn't slide down with the diaper like playtex does, so there isnt any wasted liner. This brand has never let me down. My rating is missing a star cuz just the other day when I went to empty my genie, there was a tear in the liner. Nothing I really care enough about to stop buying, but i didn't think it would happen due to the "7layers" crap. I still recommend these tho if ur trying to save $ but want something just as good, or better, than name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Diaper Genie!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the Diaper Genie! I love the price, and it does the job. They fit well in the diaper genie, I had no problems with them at all. We just ended up reverting back to a regular garbage can after living temporarily with family. Now that we have our own home again, it's hard to get back into the routine. But these are something I would definitely recommend if you're going to use a diaper genie. Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: S.Family

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the savings.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty terrible. First, they don't fit the lid cap for Diaper Gene 1. Very close, but the refills are just a centimeter too tall. Second, the bags are loose and grippy. When you push a diaper into the Gene it drags out a ton of bag. When you go to cut the bag and tie off, you find there is about a yard of bag with diapers spread throughout it. Feels like a hassle to push the diapers into a reasonable space to not waist extra bag.
customer_reviews.author: J Peter Jones

customer_reviews.title: High quality, good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value, but the "features" are lacking in two minor areas. 1. No "warning stripe" as you near the end of the cartridge. The brand name ones have this warning stripe. 2. The opening is just a touch smaller than the brand name cartridges, but this is very, very minor and in no way makes them less usable. The plastic has yet to rip for us, and we really pack these things FULL. We even hold the lid open and push the diapers down to compact them sometimes when we just don't feel like changing the bag yet, haha! Gross, I know, but come on...parents, we've all been in much nastier situations!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: They fit into the Diaper Genie, but not well - you have to mash the lid down hard and even then, there is not much internal resistance and you will find that you pull out more plastic every time you push something through. They're a little cheaper than the OEM Diaper Genie refills but I think next time I will go for the originals since these don't fit properly and waste a lot of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: rets38mot

customer_reviews.title: STINKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: These refills do not contain the stinky poop smell at all. Yes, they are cheaper than the name brand refills, but they are not worth the savings because it pretty much defeats one of the main purposes of the Diaper Genie. After I started using these cheap ones, I thought I was going crazy because I kept smelling baby poop in the nursery. I never noticed that before with the name brand refills. Even after spraying the Genie down with Lysol and pouring some baking soda into the bag (several times), it would still stink. SO NOT WORTH THE MONEY YOU SAVE. I went back to name brand and the stink is gone.
customer_reviews.author: LKS

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: These are similar to the Diaper Genie refills without the expense. I read the reviews and debated on purchasing them initially but being on a budget I went for it and I'm glad I did. They may be slightly thinner than the name brand but they do the same job. I read reviews were people commented on how they did not contain the smell but I had the same problem with the name brand. My resolution is to spray Febreeze (I have also bought the Febreeze trashcan clips and stuck them on the inside of the lid) into the bag and the smell disappears. In my personal opinion I believe this product is comparable to the Diaper Genie refills.
customer_reviews.author: pmcrn99

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the savings
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend these. I tried these because they were a little bit cheaper than the diaper genie brand that I have always used, but I will not do that again. The bags are very thin and they rip when you try and take it out to take it to the dumpster. But more importantly, there is no easy way to find the start of the bag when you open a new one. You end up having to pull out the whole bag just trying to find the beginning and then it's all taken out and ruined. It's a mess! Each one was like this. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Plow

customer_reviews.title: Just like the name brand!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried to buy a Diaper Genie Elite because I was afraid that the refills would be too expensive. Before I bought the Diaper Genie Elite I did some research on Amazon for the refills. One refill for the name brand Diaper Genie would run about 16 to 17 dollars. The off brand has 4 refills and runs $19.99. That is over 1000 bags for changing!! I didn't think that was bad at all!!!! They work great! My sister has the same Diaper Genie and she has the name brand refills from her shower and I cannot see a difference. If you are looking to save money go with these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Luann Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fit in the Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: I use a Diaper Genie for my dog. I live in a small apartment in NYC, so it's been a lifesaver. These fit perfectly in the Diaper Genie and do a good job keeping the smell contained.
customer_reviews.author: Taren

customer_reviews.title: When it was time to empty the diaper genie the bags didn't seem to drop/expand as well as the Playtex ones and I'd always end up
customer_reviews.text: While you do get more for your money than the Playtex brand bags, these just didn't seem to hold the diapers as well in the diaper genie. When it was time to empty the diaper genie the bags didn't seem to drop/expand as well as the Playtex ones and I'd always end up with a lot of slack which ended up as wasted bag. I'm not sure if it's because these are thinner than the Playtex ones. Also, a lot of the times the diaper genie lid wouldn't close properly which led to smells leaking out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N

customer_reviews.title: Knock-off that works like a knock-off.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t contain smell at all. Went back to the more expensive Diaper Genie brand.
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as DiaperGenie Brand at a much better price
customer_reviews.text: These work prefectly in a Diaper Genie II Pail and are every bit as good as the Diaper Genie brand bags at a fraction of the cost. The case that the bags are in are not quite as heavy grade plastic as the name brand equivalent, but this does not cause any problems, and in my mind is actually better as it is more environmentally friendly. The bags seem to last forever compared to the name brand as well. We get these bags under subscribe and save and will never go back to the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the name brand
customer_reviews.text: Retracting my original good review: I had compared these to the other off-brand from Target, and there it competes well. However, I'd never really tried the name brand. Well, with my baby growing older and after using these for a while I noticed the smell of the Diaper Genie had gotten so bad, I had to try something else. So I tried the Diaper Genie brand refills and there's no comparison: the name brand is MUCH better quality, doesn't slip and snake, meaning you use up less bag, and it also holds the smell MUCH better than these. It's definitely worth it to pay a little more for the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: ... ordered one set of these and the first were great -- worked just like the Genie brand
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one set of these and the first were great -- worked just like the Genie brand. The second set I ordered we are on the 3rd roll and they are HORRIBLE. The plastic isn't tight in the container, so it constantly comes out, making it twirl inside the Genie... so you have a ton of plastic hanging there, collecting condensation and you have to constantly open the Genie and pull the diapers down, and end up wasting plastic. We've tried multiple ways to alleviate it. I thought it was just a one-container problem, but we are on #3 and I'm not wasting my time with these anymore. Get Target brand -- they work and are $5 each.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Diaper Genie!
customer_reviews.text: The product quality is good but it doesn't absolutely fit in Diaper Genie Essentials. I tried it several different types and even after removing the inner guard it still keeps the lid open. Frustrated I had to return it. It was nice to have a tab where there is a start so if it does fit yours it's a good product but for Diaper Genie it does not fit. I have several at home and it doesn't fit any :(
customer_reviews.author: Artist

customer_reviews.title: Unravels into diaper pail causing lots of waste.
customer_reviews.text: These refil bags fit into the diaper genie nicely. However, the lower price does not save money compared to the diaper genie brand refills. The Nursery Fresh refill unravels much faster. I was left with a full diaper pail with only a few diapers and tons of bag that had unraveled. Even carefully holding the edge of the bag while inserting a dirty diaper didn't solve the problem. The weight of the dirty diapers in the pail is enough to cause the refill to unravel. I paid full price for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Ben and Amanda

customer_reviews.title: These were terrible. We were counting down the days until we ...
customer_reviews.text: These were terrible. We were counting down the days until we got through them as they did not contain the smell at all. Once we finished these we went back to the diaper genie ones. For only slightly more, they are MUCH better at containing the smell and it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: These are OK and better than most other versions of the refills that aren't name brand.
customer_reviews.text: For cheaper version of the diaper geenie brand refills, these ones have been the best for containing the stink. We have ordered a few other brands that are AWFUL and don't seem to contain any of the smell. If looking to save a few bucks, these are the ones to get.
customer_reviews.author: Liz S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, cheaper than the name brand products and work just as well. And they seem to last sooo much longer as well! I use them in my munchkin diaper pail. Definitely try these!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was better
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t buy this again. It doesn’t compare to the real brand. It’s thinner and the smell doesn’t hold well at all. Wasted money cause it’s not worth using. I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiko

customer_reviews.title: Smelly situation
customer_reviews.text: These work well with the munchkin pail but compared to other brands including munchkin and other generic brands, they really don’t do a good job at containing the the scent. I feel like since I started using these we have been changing the bag more frequently and my daughters room smells horrible like poop. I am very disappointed and I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Needs an indicator to let you know when the bag has almost reached its very end!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use brandname diaper genie refills and a mark would show on the bag when you approached it's end. As far as I can tell, this has no such indicator, so it's easy to put one diaper too many into the bag and cause the contents to fall out. Otherwise, it's fine, but the lack of a marker to give you warning when you're near the end is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ladapo

customer_reviews.title: Munchkin Pail compatible
customer_reviews.text: So glad we finally found these. They a much cheaper than the bags made specifically for the Munchkin Pail and these were the first ones that we found that actually fit. Many of the others we've tried stated that they worked for both the Diaper Genie and Munchkin Pail, but didn't fit and only actually fit Diaper Genie brand. FINALLY FOUND ONE THAT WORKS FOR US!
customer_reviews.author: Karly Brick

customer_reviews.title: they're cheaper than the brand name but twice now the seam has split when changing the bag of full diapers so I ended up jugglin
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second roll and so far they haven't fallen a bit short of expectations. Yes, they're cheaper than the brand name but twice now the seam has split when changing the bag of full diapers so I ended up juggling a bunch of dirty diapers trying to keep them in on the way to the trash can outside. I'll probably buy again but be more careful about how full I let it get before I change it out.
customer_reviews.author: Alison S.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT FIT PROPERLY
customer_reviews.text: We bought these because of they were a few dollars cheaper. However, it was definitely NOT worth it. They do not properly fit. As others have mentioned the inner diameter is too small. You have to force them onto the holder and the lid doesn't close as well as it does with the Diaper Genie bags. I would NOT recommend wasting your money on a sub-par product substitution. We just received the diaper bags today and have not been able to determine if we will also get to experience the odor that is mentioned in other reviews due to the poor quality plastic. We had absolutely NO odor with the Diaper Genie bags, so fingers crossed... to be continued...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the Diaper Genie liners
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a baby shower gift. Very impressed they are just as quality as the Playtex Genie liners without the high price and they fit the Diaper Genie. Many products that say they will fit a certain product, don't. My daughter has a newborn as has gone through 3 of these refills in the last month. They are durable and keep the diaper smells out of the nursery. I'd highly recommend if you want the same quality as the name brand and you want to save $$, give these a try.
customer_reviews.author: joshandles

customer_reviews.title: Skip this if you want quality bags to use in diaper genie.
customer_reviews.text: The bags work well until you get to the remaining 35-40%. The bag pulls itself out of the plastic ring and make it completely pointless for usage in the diaper genie because you have to manually open the bottom compartment to insert used diapers in the nursery fresh bag. Returning these for my old trusted and more expensive generic bags.
customer_reviews.author: Mz.Evolving

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper alternative to Diaper Genie refills
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for several years after getting a Diaper Genie when my Munchkin Arm & Hammer pail broke. These liners are great. They've torn a few times, but only when I overloaded the bag. I've used the Diaper Genie refills and notice no difference between the two other than the Nursery Fresh containers are slightly big. I just press them down really hard and the Diaper Genie lid closes just fine. I've heard they don't work with the Diaper Genies that have carbon filters in the lids, but mine does not.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Best Replacment for The Original Refills
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things out there. Comparing to the price of the original one, this is much better. I was hesitated to buy the Genie diaper disposal because I hate products with refills, where they force you to keep buying their expensive refills. This one solves the problem. Pros: -Less expensive than the original one (5$ vs $6.2) -Fit perfectly inside the Genie diaper disposal Cons: -A little bit thinner than the original one. If you don't pull it roughly and tear the bag with your fingers, it's going to just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Q8y Guy

customer_reviews.title: I like these better than the name brand that goes with the Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: I use these refills for a Playtex Diaper Genie Elite and I like them better than the Playtex refills. The plastic bag seems to be slightly thinner, which seems counter-intuitive, but I have found that the thinner bag stretches more to accommodate more diapers. Pull out a little more bag into the Genie and the diapers will pile up a little better and the Genie will not have to be changed quite as often. When the Genie is changed and the bag tied up, there is no odor. Also, they are a little less expensive than the Playtex.
customer_reviews.author: LaureN

customer_reviews.title: Wasteful
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea and so much cheaper, I tried it a few times attempting to find the nitch. There isn't one. Too much plastic is released when you push the diaper down, you end up with Loooong half empty sacks of dirty diapers to throw away. The brand name doesn't do that, everything is compact and there a special plastic that keeps tons of the plastic from coming out. You probably end up spending more on this actually because so much is wasted. And it's plastic- as in not great for the environment- so less is better imo. Stick with the brand name ones.
customer_reviews.author: Athena4mel

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, less quality product. Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I would describe these as terrible! 1) You can smell the diapers through the plastic. 2) Every time you push another diaper in the genie, more plastic goes with it. 3) They are thinner then the diaper genie brand. 4) They don't hold as many, causing the plastic to tear, which gives off the most delightful smell of 6 day old, rotted diaper! In my opinion, a total waste of money. I gave it 1 star for this reason alone. It is designed to hold old, stinky diapers. It holds them however, it DOES NOT hold the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Russell

customer_reviews.title: ZERO Odor Protection
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use but these are about the cheapest option available and it shows. The plastic is very thin and does not catch on the Munchkin twist flange that twists and seals in the odor. This leaves you with an unsealed 5 day supply of dirty diaper odor hitting you in the face every time you walk upstairs. It is also more susceptible to tears. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Greg F.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I was very interested to try these, since they seemed like a good, cheaper alternative to the Daiper Genie refillls. The only thing I was wary of was the lack of a warning line at the end of the roll, which other reviewers had mentioned was an inconvenience. It actually hasn't been a problem- I just keep an eye on how much is left when I change the diaper pail and I roughly know I can get about 5 loads from a container. Other reviewers have mentioned that the bags break easily, but I haven't found that to be the case. Bottom line, I'll be buying these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: RHuston

customer_reviews.title: ... the Diaper Genie Complete Antimicrobial Pail and they work like a charm
customer_reviews.text: We use these in the Diaper Genie Complete Antimicrobial Pail and they work like a charm, at a fraction of the cost of a name brand refill. We have used them in the pail for three months so far and have never had an issue with ripping, tearing, or odors. These are now our go-to pail liners.
customer_reviews.author: dalektible

customer_reviews.title: Good budget option, but doesn't hide the smell
customer_reviews.text: This is a great budget option! One thing to note, it does NOT mask the odor as much as the diaper genie brand ones. If your babies don't go #2 as much, and you're fine changing out the bag more often to help with the smell, than this is a good option for you. If you, say, have twins that go #2 a lot and you can't keep up daily bag disposal, then you may want to switch back to the name brand ;). I used these bags for a while, but there were many times I opened the door to the room and it really smelled bad. I switched to the name brand and the issue went way.
customer_reviews.author: Fragola

customer_reviews.title: On par with the name brand
customer_reviews.text: This refill fits just fine in our Diaper Genie Elite. I think the bag quality is on par with the name brand. Haven't had any issues with it ripping or anything. And one refill has lasted us over 2 weeks so far, while the name brand refill only lasted 1 week! We are satisfied. One tip I would suggest for anyone using the Diaper Genie: save yourself a lot of bag space by compressing the diapers downward before cutting the bag to tie. You can typically force the waste down to the bottom of the bag and save a lot of space. I saved around 2 feet length of bag by doing this.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDubya

customer_reviews.title: With price doubled, might as well by the real thing
customer_reviews.text: They work good enough, but now that the price double overnight from $20 to $40 it's not that much difference from the name brand so not really worth putting up with the imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: Very close to diaper genie, but.....
customer_reviews.text: These are comparable to the diaper genie refills, but I did find the refill did not fit perfectly in my diaper genie elite. It seemed like I had to push it down with a lot of force to get it low enough for the lid to close completely. When I had to remove it, the cone on the genie actually pulled out with the refill because it was jammed in so tight. I have a bunch of these refills left so I will have to figure out how to make them fit better, or let the lid stick up a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: E.P.

customer_reviews.title: Held up, worth reviewing
customer_reviews.text: I had to write a review because I hope this company continues to sell these. They lasted me longer than others, came with carbon filters, best value for the 8pk.
customer_reviews.author: HealthyLivingAM

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I've used the bags for the last nine months and while they're pretty sturdy they do tend to bust if you try to cram to much into them (which I usually do) the diaper genie brand I've never had a problem with but these are a bit cheaper and I can usually get a coupon for them. My biggest issue is that even though they say on the box they fit in both of the diaper genie models they are a bit too big for the elite which it was I have and sometimes the lid wont close because it gets caught on the lip of the ring.
customer_reviews.author: Anna d.

customer_reviews.title: Isolates Stinky Poo Smell
customer_reviews.text: Keeps smells contained and the 8Pack price was an amazing deal. Paid less than a 3rd the others cost but is as good as name brand!
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Smelly
customer_reviews.text: While the relatively better price attracted me to this product, I don't think I will be re-purchasing it because the smells seem to permeate through the bag at a significantly high rate than the original. Of that doesn't bother you - maybe you don't even need to be using a Genie at all. I dumped some Arm & Hammer in the bottom of the plastic Genie to absorb some of the odor penetrating the bags but eventually ended up moving the whole thing outside. If my kid wasn't close to not needing this product anymore, I'd be going back to over-paying for the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: bobkondz

customer_reviews.title: Not for Munchkin pails
customer_reviews.text: They do not fit Munchkin diaper pail. This is only reason for 1 star. They claimed to be able to go with this brand but sadly not true.
customer_reviews.author: Daria

customer_reviews.title: Smelly!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using these refills for a long time before I realized this brand just isn’t the same as the name brand for containing the odor. I changed the bag every day, even before it was full to try to cut down on the odor. It was still terrible. Basically, like not even having a diaper pail. I have gone back to the name brand and it is so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Juliet B.

customer_reviews.title: Stinky!
customer_reviews.text: These are STINKY and thin. I wish I returned and bought the name brand. I have to put poopy diapers in the garage and only use these for pee diapers. I do not recommend. They also made my diaper genie stink. The only plus is that they fit in the diaper genie.
customer_reviews.author: My Name Is

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty great and MUCH cheaper than the name brand
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty great and MUCH cheaper than the name brand. Please note that if you have the NEWEST diaper genie, you will have to pry off a piece of plastic that they put in (specifically so you're forced to use their refills! Dumb!) I have noticed that I can smell the poop more using these than I did with the name brand. But only when opening and closing it. Worth saving money, though!
customer_reviews.author: cailin

customer_reviews.title: Does not contain odors, will need to change your genie every other day
customer_reviews.text: My diaper genie refills last much longer than these refills as they fit better in the canister. These refills pull out of the container so easily I waste a lot of the bag just pushing the diapers into my genie. They also don't help at all with the "diaper smell", I much prefer a scented bag or one that would actually help contain the smell a bit. I find myself changing the canister every other day now just to make sure the nursery doesn't smell like dirty diapers. I really liked the idea of a more environmentally responsible bag and great price point but I cannot say I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: These work just fine in our older diaper genie - fit fine
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine in our older diaper genie - fit fine, serve the purpose. My only issue is that they do not hold in the odor as well as the Playtex Diaper Genie versions. I bought a large pack so I think we will keep them, but hindsight, I would go with the original.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the alternative.
customer_reviews.text: These do a good job at holding in the diapers and most of the associated smell, and fit perfectly with the munchkin diaper genie. I do wish they had a color change or indicator to let you know when you are getting close to the end of the refill; I hate emptying and tying off the bag only to find there's only a foot left of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Refills - I won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the rolls came faulty. The plastic lining inside was folded wrong and not cut so it was doubled bagged, if that makes sense. The first instance it came completely undone when I was trying to understand the problem (all was lost) and the second time I just loaded it and it lasted half as long as it should. I've been doing this for years buying from a variety of brands and this was my first and last purchase from this Nursery Fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Goodberg

customer_reviews.title: Fits Munchkin Pile
customer_reviews.text: Good product, fits munchkin pile and controls odors. Good price through subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Worst product I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I bought this is hopes of saving some money in the regular diaper genie bags. These are beyond horrible. Every time you put a diaper in the bag pulls out of the container more, so when your genie is full you end up with about 4-5 feet of extra bag, which you cannot reel in. Too bad u bought the multi-pack. The trouble isn't worth it - going in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E

customer_reviews.title: Direct refill replacements for the Diaper Genie Elite
customer_reviews.text: Direct refill replacements for the Diaper Genie Elite. They were so affordable I bought 5 packs, equaling over 5000+ diaper changes. - came in an amazon prime box - they were shrink wrapped together on top of each other just like the product picture. - I recommend all parents to purchase this if you have the diaper genie elite -  - happy parents equal happy diaper changes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tran

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice alternative to the Playtex brand refills. However, it should be noted that these are inserted differently. Playtex brand get pulled up from the top, tied, and then shoved down into the diaper genie. With this brand, you'll want to insert the refill upside down so you'll essentially be tying it from the top and the top will be in the diaper genie. Inserting them like the Playtex brand will result in a lot of wasted bag material.
customer_reviews.author: MCB

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for less the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a much less expensive version of the Diaper Genie Refill. It packages diapers, which are already expensive, so I'm all for using this brand for less money. A few things of noticed that are a bit different....1) The plastic pulls out much easier than the Playtex variety. This means you need to be more careful when emptying it or you'll end up wasting a bunch of the liner. 2) There is no warning tape that gives you a heads up that the refill is almost empty.
customer_reviews.author: Lalybe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap alternative with some small problems.
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap alternative to the real thing. I have two main complaints with these. 1) The shape of them makes the lid of the diaper genie not auto close 90% of the time. The little close latch catches on the edge of these and prevents if from closing. 2) The originals are designed in the way that the plastic comes up and makes it so that the diaper never touches anything but the inside of the plastic 'bag'. These are just open on the top so the diaper touches everything all over.
customer_reviews.author: VisionCloud

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for pricier Diaper Genie refills
customer_reviews.text: I found these refills to be a good substitute for the pricier Diaper Genie refills. It works exactly the same way. The only discernable difference I noticed was the color of the plastic (this is blue) and the feel of the plastic is slightly different. I have never had any problems with breakage, however, and have ordered this brand several times. I'll probably stick with Nursery Fresh for my Diaper Genie diaper pail until refills are no longer needed.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to the expensive Genie brand refills. I have a home child care business and change a lot of diapers. I haven't noticed any increase in odor in the changing area or needing to change to the refill more often. One refill did unravel very quickly leaving unused liner in the pail but I was able to gather the extra back up and re-use it. Someone suggested leaving the shrink wrap ring on, I'm going to try that if it happens again. However, it only occurred one time so that may not be necessary. I have tried other "generic" brands and this has been the only one I have been pleased with. It's worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: bytheby

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: I like these better than the snap ins for my munchkin pail. Best value I have found. I have a daycare so we go through more diapers than I care to count daily. I would never buy anything other than these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hinesley

customer_reviews.title: ... with our diaper genie but it doesn't fit as nice as the diaper genie brand
customer_reviews.text: only a 4 star because it does work with our diaper genie but it doesn't fit as nice as the diaper genie brand. also doens't fit the number of diaper as promised (but we don't really fill it to the top anyway coz the diaper genie cannot contain the pee or poo smell after a few days). i would still use it because it's cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Fox

customer_reviews.title: refills for my diaper/litter pail
customer_reviews.text: it is most convenient way to dispose of litter twice week I put in garbage and never have order in house
customer_reviews.author: Barb917

customer_reviews.title: Great for Diaper Genie Manufactured prior to March1, 2014
customer_reviews.text: These refills work great for my Diaper Genie Elite. The smell doesn't bother me from the dirty diapers and it fits perfectly. I did see on the new Diaper Genies a disclaimer that these particular refills do not fit Diaper Genies manufactured after March 1, 2014. So the one I got must have been manufactured before that date. If you have an older model Diaper Genie I would so go for it and save the money and but these refills. I'm not sure if they fit on the newer Diaper Genies or not though.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyA

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 diaper genies and I really wanted to find an alternative to the genie refills. These will do the job but not as well as the real thing. Mine tore when I was emptying a big bag. The plastic is thinner than genie's and just doesn't hold its shape in the canister the same way. It seems like I always have so much more plastic at the bottom from the weight of the diapers than I do with the genie brand. I'm switching back when these are done.
customer_reviews.author: JordanaDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Still expensive for what it is but cheaper than OEM.
customer_reviews.text: The price is good compared to the OEM refills, my only complaint with these is that there is not enough resistance to pulling the bag out. Unless you hold the bag with one hand while loading the diaper with the other hand, most times you'll pull out a few inches of bag and if you're not careful you'll end up with gaps. Don't cut the top of the bag off until you pull it out of the can and check for gaps, otherwise that space goes to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Smith

customer_reviews.title: Smell of dirty diapers... not same as original genie
customer_reviews.text: I bought because of the price difference between this one and the original genie. I have to say that it is ok for wet diapers, but for poop... nope! I still can smell it... that didnt happen when using the original Genie.. I think I will return it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I checked into other ways of controlling my problem and until I lose a good bit of weight the best thing for me is ...
customer_reviews.text: This may seem crazy for a senior female to have use of, but being incontenient has been a challenge anyway. I checked into other ways of controlling my problem and until I lose a good bit of weight the best thing for me is dealing with it. The Platex Genie II that I ordered and these refills are helping a lot. I don't have much company, but I have no problems odor even if it's several days before I change the bag. Since not many older people will see this, you young moms can pass it on to gram and gramps!
customer_reviews.author: Marm's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative product to the original diaper genie
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative product to the original diaper genie. This will be the last pack i buy because the cost is ridiculous for what you're getting. I was shocked you only get about 3 bags per cartridge. Kind of silly that the bag is so small (same diameter as the cartridge) and the diaper genie is so large. From now on i'll be using the garbage trick rather than wasting money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Lieder

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, then failed to fit in subsequent shipment
customer_reviews.text: When we first started buying these, I gave them 5 stars because the price is great, they fit wonderfully, and worked just as well as the name brand. Fast forward two months and another shipment of refills to find me struggling to get these to fit in my Diaper Genie Elite and they no longer mask the odors. I might as well be throwing the dirty diapers in the trash can. I won't be purchasing these again, which is a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: tosharific

customer_reviews.title: works with diaper genie
customer_reviews.text: works well with diaper genie. cheaper than brand name. i've bought these twice.
customer_reviews.author: EWW33

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than brand name refills
customer_reviews.text: I like buying in bulk- it’s a must with multiples. I think these work just as good as diaper genie refills.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent performance
customer_reviews.text: Quality control seems to be an issue. The first several packs we used were indistinguishable from the brand name we'd had before, but then we started to find that when we'd go to empty it, there would be three times as much plastic as there should have been; the diapers would take up only a very small portion of what had come unrolled from the container and the rest would end up getting thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: MJP

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for my dirty diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine but price increased in my last 2 subscribe and save orders and I switched to another brand. Having twins under 2 I go through a lot and cannot afford to keep having price go up with each order
customer_reviews.author: coco

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WONDERFULLY FOR DEPENDS.
customer_reviews.text: IT FILLS UP FAST BUT AT LEAST IT IS TIDY AND SMELLS GOOD IN MY BATHROOM.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well even though a few reviewers had complained about the thinness of the bag. One thing I've found is that because the bag is thinner than the original genie bags, it easily falls out of the container once you reach the end. Other then that, it's strong enough for normal handling.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: These worked poorly in our Diaper Genie Essentials- just like the Target store brand refills. The fit isn't just right so they leave a small gap in the housing which lets out stink. Also, they tension within the bag refill is inappropriate and too much bag gets fed through when you deposit a diaper... this leads to several feet of wasted bag with each bag change. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Heck

customer_reviews.title: Diaper Genie Elite success
customer_reviews.text: Work great in Diaper Genie Elite and cheaper than the Playtex brand. Do yourself a favor and save a little money on trash bags for your kids' diapers. There are so many other things to spend money on that are more exciting than this, so take advantage of this lower price here.
customer_reviews.author: CMsGirl

customer_reviews.title: A lot of excess material, causing this to be not very cost effective
customer_reviews.text: These refills fit the Diaper Genie Original just fine, but the bag is too loose and creates a lot of extra waste when you push the diapers through the little spring section that keeps the diaper smell in. We even tried holding onto the bag from where the bag comes out of the container when pushing the diaper through, but there was still a lot of extra material. I think it'll be a little more cost effective to continue ordering the actual Diaper Genie refills, we thought we'd have the same issue with those, but so far it has been much better with a lot less excess bag.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole H.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: Why spend more on the name-brand version when these work just as well. The packaging isn't too annoying; you just pull the plastic bag through, knot it, and place the container on top of your diaper pail. Let's face it- when your kid eats solid foods, the diapers are going to smell terrible. Love these. They aren't as thick as the name-brand kind, truth be told, but they are fully serviceable and you save a ton.
customer_reviews.author: CJ_NY

customer_reviews.title: Does the same job!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this when I ran out of diaper genie refills. The only difference that I can say is that the plastic feels a little thinner as compared to the original, but it does the job. It can hold the diapers weight and does not easily tear. I would say this is a great replacement and does the same job as intended. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: JeffR.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable
customer_reviews.text: These are better than the originals. They are less expensive and work better. The bags that came with the Diaper Genie ripped pretty easily. These stand up to the weight of all the dirty diapers. Even when you wait too long to empty them out.
customer_reviews.author: Yuro Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Easy and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Durable, easy to use and easy to install. Plus the scent of the bag is great at odor blocking!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I prefer the original ones...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price however I don't mind paying a few dollar more for the original ones which are better i my opinions. These fit my diaper genie elite + no problem but they are much thinner and fairly unscented compared to playtex original pail refill. If you are after quantity by all means get this but I prefer quality and no wonder the originals are better
customer_reviews.author: HyeMama

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive substitute for the name brand.
customer_reviews.text: These refills work really well in my Diaper Genie. I've used 3 out of the 4 refills so far and I have not encountered any of the problems other reviewers have mentioned. They fit perfectly. The plastic is strong, and hasn't ripped. I haven't noticed that the plastic "slips down" too fast. If anything, I have to push a little harder to get it to go down. Great, inexpensive substitute for the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Byrnes

product_meta.title: Nursery Fresh Refill for Diaper Genie 3 Pack, 816 Count
product_meta.description: Size:816 Count (Pack of 3)Introducing Nursery FreshTM, the less expensive refill for Diaper Genie Elite, Diaper Genie II Elite:, Diaper Genie: Essentials and Diaper Genie II. The refill bags are made with 7-layer film and offer the ultimate in odor protection. This 3 Pack of refills holds up to 816 newborn diapers. Packaging may vary.
feature_bullets: GUARANTEED TO FIT all Diaper Genie II Elite and Diaper Genie II pails, and guaranteed to fit all Diaper Genie Essentials and Diaper Genie Elite pails purchased prior to March 1, 2014
Nursery FreshTM diaper pail liners are not compatible with the Arm & HammerTM Diaper Pail by Munchkin
Nursery Fresh(TM) is not manufactured under the authorization of Playtex Products, LLC.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,305 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
